greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Irregular triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=A068063(n), read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of k-element nondividing subsets of {1, 2, ..., n}.
comment: A set is called nondividing if no element divides the sum of any nonempty subset of the other elements.
T(n,k) = 0 for k>A068063(n). The triangle contains all positive values of T.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..65, flattened
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Nondividing Set
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Mar 10 2011
